applies_to_note: Gaming (including bingo), lotteries and betting on virtual events

aim.aim_description: To reduce the risk that customers are unfairly disadvantaged by technical factors that may affect speed of response, and to ensure customers are made aware of the risk

requirements.title: Assessment and Mitigation of Speed-Related Risks
requirements.full_text: Where speed of interaction has a significant effect on the customer's chance of winning, operators must assess the level of risk and demonstrate to the Commission that they are taking reasonable steps to reduce the risk to customers.

implementation_guidance.full_text: Examples of possible approaches include: estimating the degree of network latency (delay) a customer is experiencing and displaying regularly updated information to the customer about any disadvantage that they may be operating under (for example high, medium, low); applying a handicapping system based on estimated performance and/or system latency; treating winning responses that arrive within a period of time as simultaneous and implementing a policy on how simultaneous wins are to be dealt with.
key_points: When speed of interaction significantly affects chance of winning, operators must assess risk
Must demonstrate to Commission that reasonable steps are taken to reduce risk
Approach 1: Estimate and display network latency to customer (high/medium/low)
Approach 2: Apply handicapping system based on performance/latency
Approach 3: Treat responses within time period as simultaneous with policy for simultaneous wins
implementation_guidance.risk_assessment_required: Yes - when speed of interaction has significant effect on winning chances
implementation_guidance.demonstration_required: Yes - must demonstrate to UKGC that reasonable steps are taken

example_mitigation_approaches.description: Estimate degree of network latency customer is experiencing
example_mitigation_approaches.implementation: Display regularly updated information about disadvantage (high, medium, low)

example_mitigation_approaches.description: Apply handicapping based on estimated performance and/or system latency
example_mitigation_approaches.implementation: Adjust game mechanics to compensate for technical disadvantages

example_mitigation_approaches.description: Treat winning responses arriving within a time period as simultaneous
example_mitigation_approaches.implementation: Implement policy on how simultaneous wins are dealt with

requirements.citation: UK Gambling Commission - Remote Technical Standards, RTS Requirement 4A

requirements.title: Customer Information About Technical Disadvantages
requirements.full_text: For time-critical events, the customer should be informed that they might be at a disadvantage because of technical issues such as slower network speeds, or slower end user device performance.

implementation_guidance.full_text: Information should be included in game descriptions, rules, 'help' or 'how to play' pages.
key_points: Customers must be informed they might be at disadvantage due to technical issues
Technical issues include: slower network speeds, slower device performance
Information must be included in game descriptions, rules, help, or how to play pages
implementation_guidance.warning_purpose: Ensure customers aware they might be disadvantaged by technical factors beyond their control

requirements.citation: UK Gambling Commission - Remote Technical Standards, RTS Requirement 4B

compliance_notes.overall_purpose: Protect customers from unfair disadvantages due to technical factors affecting speed of interaction
compliance_notes.enforcement_priority: Medium-High - important for fair gambling where speed matters
compliance_notes.testing_requirements: Operators must demonstrate risk assessment and mitigation measures to UKGC
key_principles: Speed-related risks must be assessed where speed affects winning chances
Reasonable mitigation steps must be taken and demonstrated
Customers must be informed of potential technical disadvantages
Multiple mitigation approaches available (latency display, handicapping, simultaneous treatment)

typical_scenarios: Real-time multiplayer games where quick responses give advantage
Live dealer games where timing affects outcomes
less_relevant_for: Slots and other games where timing doesn't affect outcome
Turn-based games with no time pressure
